trans_title: 历史重现：马尔科姆·艾克斯
introduction: The California African American Museum hosted a private premiere of “The Lost Tapes: Malcolm X” on Feb. 22. Following the premiere was a panel featuring producer Tom Jennings and curator of The National Museum of African American History and Culture, Professor Damion Thomas. “The Lost Tapes: Malcolm X” publicly premiered Monday, Feb. 26 on the Smithsonian Channel.“Presented entirely through his speeches, newscasts and rarely seen archival footage, ‘The Lost Tapes: Malcolm X’ tells the story of the man who, ‘by any means necessary,’ willingly put his life at risk to bring change and equality to Black America,” according to the Smithsonian Channel.Production Studio: 1895 FilmsDistributor: Smithsonian Channel
chinese_title: 历史重现：马尔科姆·艾克斯
